      • pRound

        public static int pRound(double n)
        Returns the value of n, as a probabilistically rounded int. The returned value will be ceiling(n) with probability p, otherwise the returned value will be floor(n). Probability p is given to be: p = n - floor(n). Thus the closer n is to ceiling(n) the higher the probability is that the result will be ceiling(n). see Gladkin 1975

      • pRound

        public static int pRound(double n,
         java.util.Random r)

      • index

        public static int index(int v,
        int[] iArray)
        Returns index i into iArray with i = ... 0 for v < iArray[0] i for iArray[i - 1] <= v < iArray[i] (where 0 < i < n) n for iArray[n - 1] <= v (where n = iArray.length) The main purpose of the function is to establish whether v falls between a non-linear set of intervals
